content: 1 The story of Nehemiah､ son of Hacaliah,—and it came to pass in the month Chislev､ in the twentieth year, when I was in Shusan the fortress
content_old: 1 The story of Nehemiah､ son of Hacaliah,—and it came to pass in the month Chislev､ in the twentieth year, when I was in Shusan the fortress

content: 2 that Hanani one of my brethren came､ he and certain men out of Judah,—so I asked them concerning the Jews who had escaped､ who were left of the captivity､ and concerning Jerusalem.
content_old: 2 that Hanani one of my brethren came､ he and certain men out of Judah,—so I asked them concerning the Jews who had escaped､ who were left of the captivity､ and concerning Jerusalem.

content: 3 And they said unto me, The remnant who are left of the captivity､ there in the province are in great misfortune and reproach, the wall of Jerusalem is broken down､ and the gates thereof are burned with fire.
content_old: 3 And they said unto me, The remnant who are left of the captivity､ there in the province are in great misfortune and reproach, the wall of Jerusalem is broken down､ and the gates thereof are burned with fire.

content: 4 And it came to pass when I heard these words that I sat down and wept, and I mourned certain days,—and continued fasting and praying, before the God of the heavens;
content_old: 4 And it came to pass when I heard these words that I sat down and wept, and I mourned certain days,—and continued fasting and praying, before the God of the heavens;

content: 5 and said, I beseech thee､ O Yahweh God of the heavens, the great and fearful God,—keeping the covenant and lovingkindness for them who love him and keep his commandments:
content_old: 5 and said, I beseech thee､ O Yahweh God of the heavens, the great and fearful God,—keeping the covenant and lovingkindness for them who love him and keep his commandments:

content: 6 Let､ I pray thee､ thine ears be attentive and thine eyes open—to hearken unto the prayer of thy servant—which I am praying before thee now､ day and night, for the sons of Israel､ thy servants,—and making confession concerning the sins of the sons of Israel､ which we have committed against thee, both I and the house of my father have sinned.
content_old: 6 Let､ I pray thee､ thine ears be attentive and thine eyes open—to hearken unto the prayer of thy servant—which I am praying before thee now､ day and night, for the sons of Israel､ thy servants,—and making confession concerning the sins of the sons of Israel､ which we have committed against thee, both I and the house of my father have sinned.

content: 7 We have dealt very corruptly against thee,—and have not kept the commandments､ nor the statutes nor the regulations, which thou didst command Moses thy servant.
content_old: 7 We have dealt very corruptly against thee,—and have not kept the commandments､ nor the statutes nor the regulations, which thou didst command Moses thy servant.

content: 8 Remember､ I pray thee､ the word, which thou didst command Moses thy servant､ saying,— If ye are unfaithful I will scatter you among the peoples:
content_old: 8 Remember､ I pray thee､ the word, which thou didst command Moses thy servant､ saying,— If ye are unfaithful I will scatter you among the peoples:

content: 10 They therefore､ are thy servants and thy people,—whom thou hast redeemed by thy great power, and by thy firm hand.
content_old: 10 They therefore､ are thy servants and thy people,—whom thou hast redeemed by thy great power, and by thy firm hand.

content: 1 And it came to pass in the month Nisan､ in the twentieth year of Artaxerxes the king that wine was before him,—so I took up the wine､ and gave unto the king, and I had never been sad before him.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass in the month Nisan､ in the twentieth year of Artaxerxes the king that wine was before him,—so I took up the wine､ and gave unto the king, and I had never been sad before him.

content: 2 Then said the king unto me､ Wherefore is thy countenance sad､ seeing that thou art not sick? this is nothing else､ but sadness of heart. Then feared I exceedingly,
content_old: 2 Then said the king unto me､ Wherefore is thy countenance sad､ seeing that thou art not sick? this is nothing else､ but sadness of heart. Then feared I exceedingly,

content: 3 and said unto the king— Let the king unto times age-abiding live! Wherefore should my countenance not be sad､ when the city—the place of the sepulchres of my fathers lieth waste, and the gates thereof are consumed with fire?
content_old: 3 and said unto the king— Let the king unto times age-abiding live! Wherefore should my countenance not be sad､ when the city—the place of the sepulchres of my fathers lieth waste, and the gates thereof are consumed with fire?

content: 4 Then the king said to me, Concerning what is it thou wouldst make request? So I prayed unto the God of the heavens,
content_old: 4 Then the king said to me, Concerning what is it thou wouldst make request? So I prayed unto the God of the heavens,

content: 5 and then said unto the king, If unto the king it seemeth good, and if thy servant might find favour before thee That thou wouldst send me unto Judah､ unto the city of the sepulchres of my fathers､ that I might build it.
content_old: 5 and then said unto the king, If unto the king it seemeth good, and if thy servant might find favour before thee That thou wouldst send me unto Judah､ unto the city of the sepulchres of my fathers､ that I might build it.

content: 6 And the king said unto me､ the queen also sitting beside him､ For how long would be thy journey? and when wouldst thou return? So it seemed good before the king to send me, and I set him a time.
content_old: 6 And the king said unto me､ the queen also sitting beside him､ For how long would be thy journey? and when wouldst thou return? So it seemed good before the king to send me, and I set him a time.

content: 7 Then said I unto the king, If unto the king it seemeth good may letters be given me, unto the pashas Beyond the River,—that they may convey me over, until I come into Judah;
content_old: 7 Then said I unto the king, If unto the king it seemeth good may letters be given me, unto the pashas Beyond the River,—that they may convey me over, until I come into Judah;

content: 8 also a letter unto Asaph､ keeper of the park that belongeth unto the king､ that he may give me timber to build up the gates of the fortress which pertaineth to the house､ and for the wall of the city, and for the house whereinto I shall enter. And the king gave me, according to the good hand of my God upon me.
content_old: 8 also a letter unto Asaph､ keeper of the park that belongeth unto the king､ that he may give me timber to build up the gates of the fortress which pertaineth to the house､ and for the wall of the city, and for the house whereinto I shall enter. And the king gave me, according to the good hand of my God upon me.

content: 9 Then came I unto the pashas Beyond the River, and gave them the letters of the king,—now the king had sent with me captains of the army､ and horsemen.
content_old: 9 Then came I unto the pashas Beyond the River, and gave them the letters of the king,—now the king had sent with me captains of the army､ and horsemen.

content: 10 And when Sanballat the Horonite､ and Tobiah the servant the Ammonite､ heard of it it vexed them､ with a great vexation,���that there had come a man, to seek welfare､ for the sons of Israel.
content_old: 10 And when Sanballat the Horonite､ and Tobiah the servant the Ammonite､ heard of it it vexed them､ with a great vexation,���that there had come a man, to seek welfare､ for the sons of Israel.

content: 11 So I entered Jerusalem,—and was there three days.
content_old: 11 So I entered Jerusalem,—and was there three days.

content: 12 Then rose I by night､ I､ and a few men with me, I having told no man, what my God had been putting in my heart､ to do for Jerusalem,—and beast was there none with me, save the beast on which I myself was riding.
content_old: 12 Then rose I by night､ I､ and a few men with me, I having told no man, what my God had been putting in my heart､ to do for Jerusalem,—and beast was there none with me, save the beast on which I myself was riding.

content: 13 So I went forth through the valley-gate by night､ even unto the front of the snake-fountain, and into the dung-gate,—and I viewed the walls of Jerusalem､ how they were broken down, and the gates thereof consumed with fire.
content_old: 13 So I went forth through the valley-gate by night､ even unto the front of the snake-fountain, and into the dung-gate,—and I viewed the walls of Jerusalem､ how they were broken down, and the gates thereof consumed with fire.

content: 14 Then passed I over unto the fountain-gate, and unto the pool of the king,—but there was no place for the beast that was under me to pass.
content_old: 14 Then passed I over unto the fountain-gate, and unto the pool of the king,—but there was no place for the beast that was under me to pass.

content: 15 Then went I up in the torrent-bed､ by night, and viewed the wall,—and turned back､ and entered by the valley-gate､ and so returned.
content_old: 15 Then went I up in the torrent-bed､ by night, and viewed the wall,—and turned back､ and entered by the valley-gate､ and so returned.

content: 16 Now the deputies knew not whither I had gone, nor what I was doing,—not even to the Jews､ nor to the priests､ nor to the nobles､ nor to the deputies､ nor to the rest who were doing the work had I as yet told it.
content_old: 16 Now the deputies knew not whither I had gone, nor what I was doing,—not even to the Jews､ nor to the priests､ nor to the nobles､ nor to the deputies､ nor to the rest who were doing the work had I as yet told it.

content: 17 So I said unto them, Ye can see the misfortune that we are in, how that Jerusalem lieth waste, and the gates thereof are burned with fire: Come､ and let us build the wall of Jerusalem, that we may remain､ no longer､ a reproach.
content_old: 17 So I said unto them, Ye can see the misfortune that we are in, how that Jerusalem lieth waste, and the gates thereof are burned with fire: Come､ and let us build the wall of Jerusalem, that we may remain､ no longer､ a reproach.

content: 18 Then told I them､ of the hand of my God､ that it had been good upon me, as also of the words of the king､ which he had spoken unto me,—so they said､ We will arise and build! and they strengthened their hands right well.
content_old: 18 Then told I them､ of the hand of my God､ that it had been good upon me, as also of the words of the king､ which he had spoken unto me,—so they said､ We will arise and build! and they strengthened their hands right well.

content: 19 But when Sanballat the Horonite､ and Tobiah the servant the Ammonite､ and Geshem the Arabian､ heard it they laughed at us, and poured contempt upon us,—and said､ What is this thing which ye would do? against the king would ye rebel?
content_old: 19 But when Sanballat the Horonite､ and Tobiah the servant the Ammonite､ and Geshem the Arabian､ heard it they laughed at us, and poured contempt upon us,—and said､ What is this thing which ye would do? against the king would ye rebel?

content: 1 Then arose Eliashib the high priest and his brethren the priests､ and built the sheep-gate, they hallowed it､ and set up the doors thereof,—even unto the tower of Hammeah hallowed they it, unto the tower of Hananel;
content_old: 1 Then arose Eliashib the high priest and his brethren the priests､ and built the sheep-gate, they hallowed it､ and set up the doors thereof,—even unto the tower of Hammeah hallowed they it, unto the tower of Hananel;

content: 2 and at his hand built､ the men of Jericho,—and at his other hand built Zaccur､ son of Imri.
content_old: 2 and at his hand built､ the men of Jericho,—and at his other hand built Zaccur､ son of Imri.

content: 3 And the fish-gate did the sons of Hassenaah build,—they laid the beams thereof, and set up the doors thereof､ the locks thereof､ and the bars thereof;
content_old: 3 And the fish-gate did the sons of Hassenaah build,—they laid the beams thereof, and set up the doors thereof､ the locks thereof､ and the bars thereof;

content: 4 and at their hand repaired､ Meremoth son of Uriah son of Hakkoz, and at their hand repaired､ Meshullum son of Berechiah son of Meshezabel,— and at their hand repaired､ Zadok son of Baana;
content_old: 4 and at their hand repaired､ Meremoth son of Uriah son of Hakkoz, and at their hand repaired､ Meshullum son of Berechiah son of Meshezabel,— and at their hand repaired､ Zadok son of Baana;

content: 5 and at their hand repaired､ the Tekoites,—but their chiefs put not their neek into the service of their lords.
content_old: 5 and at their hand repaired､ the Tekoites,—but their chiefs put not their neek into the service of their lords.

content: 6  And the old gate did Joiada son of Paseah, and Meshullam､ son of Besodeiah､ repair,—they laid the beams thereof, and set up the doors thereof､ and the locks thereof､ and the bars thereof;
content_old: 6  And the old gate did Joiada son of Paseah, and Meshullam､ son of Besodeiah､ repair,—they laid the beams thereof, and set up the doors thereof､ and the locks thereof､ and the bars thereof;

content: 7 and at their hand repaired､ Melatiah the Gibeonite and Jadon the Meronothite, men of Gibeon and of Mizpah,—who pertained to the throne of the pasha Beyond the River;
content_old: 7 and at their hand repaired､ Melatiah the Gibeonite and Jadon the Meronothite, men of Gibeon and of Mizpah,—who pertained to the throne of the pasha Beyond the River;

content: 8 at his hand repaired､ Uzziel son of Harhaiah､ goldsmiths, and at his hand repaired､ Hananiah son of the perfumers,—and they fortified Jerusalem, as far as the broad wall;
content_old: 8 at his hand repaired､ Uzziel son of Harhaiah､ goldsmiths, and at his hand repaired､ Hananiah son of the perfumers,—and they fortified Jerusalem, as far as the broad wall;

content: 9 and at their hand repaired､ Rephaiah son of Hur, ruler of a half-circuit of Jerusalem;
content_old: 9 and at their hand repaired､ Rephaiah son of Hur, ruler of a half-circuit of Jerusalem;

content: 10 and at their hand repaired､ Jedaiah son of Harumaph､ even over against his own house,— and at his hand repaired､ Hattush､ son of Hashabneiah;
content_old: 10 and at their hand repaired､ Jedaiah son of Harumaph､ even over against his own house,— and at his hand repaired､ Hattush､ son of Hashabneiah;

content: 11 a second length did Malchijah son of Harim and Hasshub son of Pahath-moab､ repair,—also the tower of the ovens;
content_old: 11 a second length did Malchijah son of Harim and Hasshub son of Pahath-moab､ repair,—also the tower of the ovens;

content: 12 and at his hand repaired､ Shallum son of Hallohesh, ruler of a half-circuit of Jerusalem,—he and his daughters.
content_old: 12 and at his hand repaired､ Shallum son of Hallohesh, ruler of a half-circuit of Jerusalem,—he and his daughters.

content: 13 The valleygate did Hanun and the inhabitants of Zanoah､ repair,—they built it, and set up the doors thereof､ the locks thereof､ and the bars thereof,—also a thousand cubits in the wall, as far as the dung-gate.
content_old: 13 The valleygate did Hanun and the inhabitants of Zanoah､ repair,—they built it, and set up the doors thereof､ the locks thereof､ and the bars thereof,—also a thousand cubits in the wall, as far as the dung-gate.

content: 14 And the dung-gate did Malchijah son of Rechab､ ruler of the circuit of Beth-haccherem､ repair,—he built it, and set up the doors thereof､ the locks thereof､ and the bars thereof.
content_old: 14 And the dung-gate did Malchijah son of Rechab､ ruler of the circuit of Beth-haccherem､ repair,—he built it, and set up the doors thereof､ the locks thereof､ and the bars thereof.

content: 15 And the fountain-gate did Shallun son of Col-hozeh ruler of the circuit of Mizpah､ repair, he built it､ and covered it, and set up the doors thereof､ the locks thereof､ and the bars thereof,—also the wall of the pool of Shelah､ by the garden of the king, even as far as the stairs that go down from the city of David;
content_old: 15 And the fountain-gate did Shallun son of Col-hozeh ruler of the circuit of Mizpah､ repair, he built it､ and covered it, and set up the doors thereof､ the locks thereof､ and the bars thereof,—also the wall of the pool of Shelah､ by the garden of the king, even as far as the stairs that go down from the city of David;

content: 16 after him repaired､ Nehemiah son of Azbuk, ruler of the half-circuit of Beth-zur,—as far as over against the sepulchres of David, even unto the pool which had been made､ and unto the house of heroes;
content_old: 16 after him repaired､ Nehemiah son of Azbuk, ruler of the half-circuit of Beth-zur,—as far as over against the sepulchres of David, even unto the pool which had been made､ and unto the house of heroes;

content: 17 after him repaired､ the Levites､ Rehum son of Bani,—at his hand repaired､ Hashabiah､ ruler of the half-circuit of Keilah､ for his circuit;
content_old: 17 after him repaired､ the Levites､ Rehum son of Bani,—at his hand repaired､ Hashabiah､ ruler of the half-circuit of Keilah､ for his circuit;

content: 18 after him repaired､ their brethren, Bavvai son of Henadad,—ruler of the other half-circuit of Keilah;
content_old: 18 after him repaired､ their brethren, Bavvai son of Henadad,—ruler of the other half-circuit of Keilah;

content: 19 and there repaired at his hand､ Ezer son of Jeshua､ ruler of Mizpah､ a second length,—over against the ascent of the armoury､ at the corner;
content_old: 19 and there repaired at his hand､ Ezer son of Jeshua､ ruler of Mizpah､ a second length,—over against the ascent of the armoury､ at the corner;

content: 20 after him zealously repaired Baruch son of Zabbai､ a second length,—from the corner, unto the opening of the house of Eliashib､ the high priest;
content_old: 20 after him zealously repaired Baruch son of Zabbai､ a second length,—from the corner, unto the opening of the house of Eliashib､ the high priest;

content: 21 after him repaired､ Meremoth son of Uriah son of Hakkoz､ a second length,—from the opening of the house of Eliashib, even unto the end of the house of Eliashib;
content_old: 21 after him repaired､ Meremoth son of Uriah son of Hakkoz､ a second length,—from the opening of the house of Eliashib, even unto the end of the house of Eliashib;

content: 22 and after him repaired､ the priests, the men of the Circuit;
content_old: 22 and after him repaired､ the priests, the men of the Circuit;

content: 23 after him repaired､ Benjamin and Hasshub､ over against their own house,—after him repaired､ Azariah son of Maaseiah son of Ananiah､ beside his own house;
content_old: 23 after him repaired､ Benjamin and Hasshub､ over against their own house,—after him repaired､ Azariah son of Maaseiah son of Ananiah､ beside his own house;

content: 24 after him repaired､ Binnui son of Henadad､ a second length,—from the house of Azariah, unto the corner､ even unto the pinnacle:
content_old: 24 after him repaired､ Binnui son of Henadad､ a second length,—from the house of Azariah, unto the corner､ even unto the pinnacle:

content: 25 Palal son of Uzai､ from over against the corner, and the tower that projecteth from the upper house of the king､ which belongeth to the court of custody,—after him Pedaiah son of Parosh.
content_old: 25 Palal son of Uzai､ from over against the corner, and the tower that projecteth from the upper house of the king､ which belongeth to the court of custody,—after him Pedaiah son of Parosh.

content: 26 Now the Nethinimll were dwelling in Ophel,—as far as over against the water-gate､ on the east, and the tower that projecteth;
content_old: 26 Now the Nethinimll were dwelling in Ophel,—as far as over against the water-gate､ on the east, and the tower that projecteth;

content: 27 after him repaired､ the Tekoites､ a second length,—from over against the great tower that projecteth, even unto the wall of Ophel:
content_old: 27 after him repaired､ the Tekoites､ a second length,—from over against the great tower that projecteth, even unto the wall of Ophel:

content: 28 from beside the horse-gate repaired the priests, every one over against his own house;
content_old: 28 from beside the horse-gate repaired the priests, every one over against his own house;

content: 29 after him repaired､ Zadok son of Immer､ over against his own house,—and after him repaired､ She-maiah son of Shecaniah, keeper of the east-gate;
content_old: 29 after him repaired､ Zadok son of Immer､ over against his own house,—and after him repaired､ She-maiah son of Shecaniah, keeper of the east-gate;

content: 30 after him repaired､ Hananiah son of Shelemiah､ and Hanun sixth son of Zalaph､ a second length,—after him repaired､ Meshullam son of Berechiah, over against his chamber;
content_old: 30 after him repaired､ Hananiah son of Shelemiah､ and Hanun sixth son of Zalaph､ a second length,—after him repaired､ Meshullam son of Berechiah, over against his chamber;

content: 31 after him repaired､ Malchijah son of Zorphi, as far as the house of the Nethinim, and the traders,—over against the muster-gate､ even unto the ascent of the pinnacle;
content_old: 31 after him repaired､ Malchijah son of Zorphi, as far as the house of the Nethinim, and the traders,—over against the muster-gate､ even unto the ascent of the pinnacle;

content: 1 But it came to pass when Sanballat heard that we were building the wall it angered him, and he was greatly displeased,—and mocked the Jews;
content_old: 1 But it came to pass when Sanballat heard that we were building the wall it angered him, and he was greatly displeased,—and mocked the Jews;

content: 2 and spake before his brethren､ and the army of Samaria, and said､ What are these feeble Jews doing? will they fortify themselves? will they sacrifice? will they make an end in a day? will they bring to life the stones out of the heaps of dust､ when they have been burned up?
content_old: 2 and spake before his brethren､ and the army of Samaria, and said､ What are these feeble Jews doing? will they fortify themselves? will they sacrifice? will they make an end in a day? will they bring to life the stones out of the heaps of dust､ when they have been burned up?

content: 3 Now Tobiah the Ammonite was beside him,—so he said､ Even that which they are building if a fox should go up he would break down their stone wall!
content_old: 3 Now Tobiah the Ammonite was beside him,—so he said､ Even that which they are building if a fox should go up he would break down their stone wall!

content: 4 Hear､ O our God､ for we have become a contempt, and turn thou back their reproach upon their own head,—and give them up as a prey､ in the land of captivity;
content_old: 4 Hear､ O our God､ for we have become a contempt, and turn thou back their reproach upon their own head,—and give them up as a prey､ in the land of captivity;

content: 5 and do not cover their iniquity, and their sin before thee let it not be blotted out,—for they have caused vexation before them who are building.
content_old: 5 and do not cover their iniquity, and their sin before thee let it not be blotted out,—for they have caused vexation before them who are building.

content: 6 So we built the wall, and all the wall was finished unto the half thereof,—and the people had a mind to work.
content_old: 6 So we built the wall, and all the wall was finished unto the half thereof,—and the people had a mind to work.

content: 7 But it came to pass when Sanballat and Tobiah and the Arabians and the Ammonites and the Ashdodites heard that the repair of the walls of Jerusalem had gone up, that the breaches began to be stopped that it angered them exceedingly;
content_old: 7 But it came to pass when Sanballat and Tobiah and the Arabians and the Ammonites and the Ashdodites heard that the repair of the walls of Jerusalem had gone up, that the breaches began to be stopped that it angered them exceedingly;

content: 8 and they conspired､ all of them together, to come､ to fight against Jerusalem,—and to cause it harm;
content_old: 8 and they conspired､ all of them together, to come､ to fight against Jerusalem,—and to cause it harm;

content: 9 howbeit we prayed unto our God,—and set a watch against them､ day and night､ because of them.
content_old: 9 howbeit we prayed unto our God,—and set a watch against them､ day and night､ because of them.

content: 10 Then said Judah､ The strength of the burden-bearer faileth, and the rubbish aboundeth,—and we are not able to build at the wall;
content_old: 10 Then said Judah､ The strength of the burden-bearer faileth, and the rubbish aboundeth,—and we are not able to build at the wall;

content: 11 and our adversaries have said､ They shall not know､ neither shall they see, until we come into their midst､ and slay them,—so shall we cause the work to cease.
content_old: 11 and our adversaries have said､ They shall not know､ neither shall they see, until we come into their midst､ and slay them,—so shall we cause the work to cease.

content: 12 But it came to pass when the Jews dwelling near them came in then said they unto us､ ten times, From all places whither ye shall turn they will be upon us!
content_old: 12 But it came to pass when the Jews dwelling near them came in then said they unto us､ ten times, From all places whither ye shall turn they will be upon us!

content: 13 So I set—on the lower slopes of the place behind the wall in the waste grounds,—yea I set the people､ by their families, with their swords､ their spears and their bows.
content_old: 13 So I set—on the lower slopes of the place behind the wall in the waste grounds,—yea I set the people､ by their families, with their swords､ their spears and their bows.

content: 14 Then I looked and rose up､ and said—unto the nobles and unto the deputies and unto the rest of the people, Do not ye fear because of them,—the great and fearful Lord remember ye, so shall ye fight for your brethren､ your sons and your daughters, your wives､ and your houses.
content_old: 14 Then I looked and rose up､ and said—unto the nobles and unto the deputies and unto the rest of the people, Do not ye fear because of them,—the great and fearful Lord remember ye, so shall ye fight for your brethren､ your sons and your daughters, your wives､ and your houses.

content: 15 And it came to pass when our enemies heard that it was known to us, and that God had overturned their counsel then returned we､ all of us､ unto the wall, every man unto his work.
content_old: 15 And it came to pass when our enemies heard that it was known to us, and that God had overturned their counsel then returned we､ all of us､ unto the wall, every man unto his work.

content: 16 And it came to pass from that day the half of my young men were working in the work, and the half of them were grasping the spears､ the bucklers, and the bows､ and the coats of mail,—but the rulersll were behind all the house of Judah.
content_old: 16 And it came to pass from that day the half of my young men were working in the work, and the half of them were grasping the spears､ the bucklers, and the bows､ and the coats of mail,—but the rulersll were behind all the house of Judah.

content: 17 They who were building at the wall and they who were carrying burdens､ they who were lifting each man with his one hand was working at the work, and with the other was grasping the weapon.
content_old: 17 They who were building at the wall and they who were carrying burdens､ they who were lifting each man with his one hand was working at the work, and with the other was grasping the weapon.

content: 18 Even they who were building every man had his sword girded upon his loins､ and so was building,—and he that sounded the horn was by my side.
content_old: 18 Even they who were building every man had his sword girded upon his loins､ and so was building,—and he that sounded the horn was by my side.

content: 19 So I said unto the nobles and unto the deputies､ and unto the rest of the people, The work is great and large,—and we are separated upon the wall, far away､ each man from his brother:
content_old: 19 So I said unto the nobles and unto the deputies､ and unto the rest of the people, The work is great and large,—and we are separated upon the wall, far away､ each man from his brother:

content: 20 In what place soever ye shall hear the sound of the horn thither gather yourselves unto us,—our God will fight for us.
content_old: 20 In what place soever ye shall hear the sound of the horn thither gather yourselves unto us,—our God will fight for us.

content: 21 So we were working at the work,—one half of them grasping the spears, from the uprisings of the dawn､ until the coming out of the stars.
content_old: 21 So we were working at the work,—one half of them grasping the spears, from the uprisings of the dawn､ until the coming out of the stars.

content: 22 Moreover at that time I said to the people, Let every one with his young man lodge for the night in the midst of Jerusalem,—so shall they serve us､ in the night､ as a watch､ and the day for work.
content_old: 22 Moreover at that time I said to the people, Let every one with his young man lodge for the night in the midst of Jerusalem,—so shall they serve us､ in the night､ as a watch､ and the day for work.

content: 1 Then came there to be a great outcry of the people and their wives,—against their brethren the Jews.
content_old: 1 Then came there to be a great outcry of the people and their wives,—against their brethren the Jews.

content: 2 And there were some who were saying, Our sons and our daughters are we pledging,—that we may obtain corn､ and eat､ and keep ourselves alive.
content_old: 2 And there were some who were saying, Our sons and our daughters are we pledging,—that we may obtain corn､ and eat､ and keep ourselves alive.

content: 3 And there were some who were saying, Our fields and our vineyards and our houses are we pledging,—that we may obtain corn in the dearth.
content_old: 3 And there were some who were saying, Our fields and our vineyards and our houses are we pledging,—that we may obtain corn in the dearth.

content: 4 And there were others who were saying, We have borrowed silver､ for the king’s tribute,—upon our lands and our vineyards.
content_old: 4 And there were others who were saying, We have borrowed silver､ for the king’s tribute,—upon our lands and our vineyards.

content: 5 Now therefore､ as is the flesh of our brethren so is our flesh, as are their children so are our children. Yet lo! we are putting in subjection our sons and our daughters､ for bondservants､ yea there are some of our daughters already trodden down､ and we are powerless, and our fields and our vineyards belong to others.
content_old: 5 Now therefore､ as is the flesh of our brethren so is our flesh, as are their children so are our children. Yet lo! we are putting in subjection our sons and our daughters､ for bondservants､ yea there are some of our daughters already trodden down､ and we are powerless, and our fields and our vineyards belong to others.

content: 6 And it angered me greatly,—when I heard their outcry, and these words.
content_old: 6 And it angered me greatly,—when I heard their outcry, and these words.

content: 7 So my heart took counsel unto me and I contended with the nobles and with the deputies, and said to them､ A loan on interest—every man to his brother are ye making,— So I appointed over them a great assembly;
content_old: 7 So my heart took counsel unto me and I contended with the nobles and with the deputies, and said to them､ A loan on interest—every man to his brother are ye making,— So I appointed over them a great assembly;

content: 8 and I said unto them､ We have bought our brethren the Jews､ who had sold themselves unto the nations､ according to our ability, and will ye even sell your brethren､ or shall they sell themselves unto us? And they were silent, and found no answer.
content_old: 8 and I said unto them､ We have bought our brethren the Jews､ who had sold themselves unto the nations､ according to our ability, and will ye even sell your brethren､ or shall they sell themselves unto us? And they were silent, and found no answer.

content: 9 Then said I, Not good is the thing which ye are doing,—ought ye not in the fear of God to walk, because of the reproach of the nations､ our enemies?
content_old: 9 Then said I, Not good is the thing which ye are doing,—ought ye not in the fear of God to walk, because of the reproach of the nations､ our enemies?

content: 10 I too､ then､ my brethren and my young men, might be lending unto them on interest silver and corn! I pray you､ let us leave off this lending on interest!
content_old: 10 I too､ then､ my brethren and my young men, might be lending unto them on interest silver and corn! I pray you､ let us leave off this lending on interest!

content: 11 Restore､ I pray you､ unto them this very day､ their fields､ their vineyards､ their oliveyards､ and their houses,—also the hundredth of silver and corn､ new wine and oil, for which ye have been lending to them.
content_old: 11 Restore､ I pray you､ unto them this very day､ their fields､ their vineyards､ their oliveyards､ and their houses,—also the hundredth of silver and corn､ new wine and oil, for which ye have been lending to them.

content: 12 And they said､ We will restore them､ and from them will we require nothing, so will we do､ as thou art saying. Then called I the priests, and put them on oath､ to do according to this promise.
content_old: 12 And they said､ We will restore them､ and from them will we require nothing, so will we do､ as thou art saying. Then called I the priests, and put them on oath､ to do according to this promise.

content: 13 Also my lap shook I out､ and said— Thus and thus may God shake out every man who shall not confirm this promise､ out of his house and out of his labour, yea thus and thus let him be shaken out and empty,— And all the convocation said､ Amen! and praised Yahweh, and the people did according to this promise.
content_old: 13 Also my lap shook I out､ and said— Thus and thus may God shake out every man who shall not confirm this promise､ out of his house and out of his labour, yea thus and thus let him be shaken out and empty,— And all the convocation said､ Amen! and praised Yahweh, and the people did according to this promise.

content: 14 Moreover from the day I was commanded to become their pasha in the land of Judah, from the twentieth year､ even unto the thirty-second year of Artaxerxes the king, twelve years I and my brethren pasha’a bread have not eaten;
content_old: 14 Moreover from the day I was commanded to become their pasha in the land of Judah, from the twentieth year､ even unto the thirty-second year of Artaxerxes the king, twelve years I and my brethren pasha’a bread have not eaten;

content: 15 whereas the former pashas､ who were before me suffered themselves to be a burden upon the people､ and took from them in bread and wine､ besides forty shekels of silver, even their young men bare rule over the people,—but I did not so, because of the fear of God.
content_old: 15 whereas the former pashas､ who were before me suffered themselves to be a burden upon the people､ and took from them in bread and wine､ besides forty shekels of silver, even their young men bare rule over the people,—but I did not so, because of the fear of God.

content: 16 Moreover also in this work of the wall I repaired, and no field did we buy,—though all my young men were gathered thither unto the work.
content_old: 16 Moreover also in this work of the wall I repaired, and no field did we buy,—though all my young men were gathered thither unto the work.

content: 17 And Jews and deputies､ a hundred and fifty men､ and they who were coming in unto us from among the nations which were round about us depended upon my table.
content_old: 17 And Jews and deputies､ a hundred and fifty men､ and they who were coming in unto us from among the nations which were round about us depended upon my table.

content: 18 Now that which was prepared for a single day was—one ox､ six choice sheep, also fowls were prepared for me, and apportioned unto ten days of every sort of wine､ in abundance,—yet in spite of this the bread of the pasha demanded I not, because heavy was the bondage upon this people.
content_old: 18 Now that which was prepared for a single day was—one ox､ six choice sheep, also fowls were prepared for me, and apportioned unto ten days of every sort of wine､ in abundance,—yet in spite of this the bread of the pasha demanded I not, because heavy was the bondage upon this people.

content: 1 And it came to pass when it was reported to Sanballat and Tobiah and to Geshem the Arabian and to the rest of our enemies､ that I had built the wall, and there was left therein no breach,—though up to that time､ the doors had I not set up in the gates
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when it was reported to Sanballat and Tobiah and to Geshem the Arabian and to the rest of our enemies､ that I had built the wall, and there was left therein no breach,—though up to that time､ the doors had I not set up in the gates

content: 2 that Sanballat and Geshem sent unto me､ saying, Come! and let us meet together in the villages､ in the valley of Ono,— But they were plotting to do me harm.
content_old: 2 that Sanballat and Geshem sent unto me､ saying, Come! and let us meet together in the villages､ in the valley of Ono,— But they were plotting to do me harm.

content: 3 So I sent unto them messengers､ saying, A great work am I doing, and cannot come down,—wherefore should the work cease whilst I leave it, and come down unto you?
content_old: 3 So I sent unto them messengers､ saying, A great work am I doing, and cannot come down,—wherefore should the work cease whilst I leave it, and come down unto you?

content: 4 Yet they sent unto me､ according to this message､ four times,—and I replied to them according to this answer.
content_old: 4 Yet they sent unto me､ according to this message､ four times,—and I replied to them according to this answer.

content: 5 Then Sanballat sent unto me､ according to this message､ a fifth time､ by his young man,—with an open letter､ in his hand:
content_old: 5 Then Sanballat sent unto me､ according to this message､ a fifth time､ by his young man,—with an open letter､ in his hand:

content: 6 wherein was written— Among the nations it is reported､ and Gashmu saith it, that thou and the Jews are plotting to rebel, for which cause thou art building the wall,—and thou art to become their king, according to these words.
content_old: 6 wherein was written— Among the nations it is reported､ and Gashmu saith it, that thou and the Jews are plotting to rebel, for which cause thou art building the wall,—and thou art to become their king, according to these words.

content: 7 Moreover also prophets hast thou set up to make proclamation concerning thee in Jerusalem､ saying, He hath become king in Judah! Now therefore､ will it be reported to the king, according to these words. Now therefore､ come, and let us take counsel together.
content_old: 7 Moreover also prophets hast thou set up to make proclamation concerning thee in Jerusalem､ saying, He hath become king in Judah! Now therefore､ will it be reported to the king, according to these words. Now therefore､ come, and let us take counsel together.

content: 8 Then sent I unto him､ saying, Nothing hath been done､ according to these words, which thou art saying,—but out of thine own heart art thou feigning them.
content_old: 8 Then sent I unto him､ saying, Nothing hath been done､ according to these words, which thou art saying,—but out of thine own heart art thou feigning them.

content: 9 For they all were seeking to put us in fear､ saying, Their hands will slacken from the work､ and it will not be accomplished. Now therefore､ strengthen thou my hands!
content_old: 9 For they all were seeking to put us in fear､ saying, Their hands will slacken from the work､ and it will not be accomplished. Now therefore､ strengthen thou my hands!

content: 10 When I came into the house of Shemaiah､son of Delaiah､ son of Mehetabel､ he being shut in he said､ Let us meet together in the house of God､ in the midst of the temple､ and let us close the doors of the temple, for they are coming to slay thee, yea by night are they coming to slay thee.
content_old: 10 When I came into the house of Shemaiah､son of Delaiah､ son of Mehetabel､ he being shut in he said､ Let us meet together in the house of God､ in the midst of the temple､ and let us close the doors of the temple, for they are coming to slay thee, yea by night are they coming to slay thee.

content: 11 Then said I､ Should such a man as I flee? Who then being such as I would enter the temple to save his life? I will not enter.
content_old: 11 Then said I､ Should such a man as I flee? Who then being such as I would enter the temple to save his life? I will not enter.

content: 12 Then perceived I､ that lo! it was not God who had sent him,—though a prophecy he had spoken concerning me, but Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him:
content_old: 12 Then perceived I､ that lo! it was not God who had sent him,—though a prophecy he had spoken concerning me, but Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him:

content: 13 to this end hired he was, to the end that I might be afraid and do so､ and might sin,—and it might serve them for an evil report, to the end they might bring reproach upon me.
content_old: 13 to this end hired he was, to the end that I might be afraid and do so､ and might sin,—and it might serve them for an evil report, to the end they might bring reproach upon me.

content: 14 Have remembrance､ O my God､ of Tobiah and of Sanballat､ according to these their doings,—moreover also of Noadiah the prophetess, and of the rest of the prophets, who would have put me in fear.
content_old: 14 Have remembrance､ O my God､ of Tobiah and of Sanballat､ according to these their doings,—moreover also of Noadiah the prophetess, and of the rest of the prophets, who would have put me in fear.

content: 15 So the wall was finished, on the twenty-fifth of Elul,—in fifty-two days.
content_old: 15 So the wall was finished, on the twenty-fifth of Elul,—in fifty-two days.

content: 16 And it came to pass when all our enemies heard, and all the nations that were round about us saw that they fell greatly in their own eyes, and took knowledge that from God had this work been wrought.
content_old: 16 And it came to pass when all our enemies heard, and all the nations that were round about us saw that they fell greatly in their own eyes, and took knowledge that from God had this work been wrought.

content: 17 Moreover in those days were the nobles of Judah busy with their letters which were going unto Tobiah,—and those of Tobiah were coming unto them;
content_old: 17 Moreover in those days were the nobles of Judah busy with their letters which were going unto Tobiah,—and those of Tobiah were coming unto them;

content: 18 for many in Judah had taken an oath to him, because he was in marriage affinity with Shecaniah son of Arah,—and Jehohanan his son had taken the daughter of Meshullam､ son of Berechiah.
content_old: 18 for many in Judah had taken an oath to him, because he was in marriage affinity with Shecaniah son of Arah,—and Jehohanan his son had taken the daughter of Meshullam､ son of Berechiah.

content: 1 And it came to pass when the wall was built, and I had set up the doors,—and the doorkeepers and the singers and the Levites had been appointed
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when the wall was built, and I had set up the doors,—and the doorkeepers and the singers and the Levites had been appointed

content: 2 that I gave Hanani my brother､ and Hananiah captain of the castle､ charge over Jerusalem, for he was a truly faithful man, and revered God above many.
content_old: 2 that I gave Hanani my brother､ and Hananiah captain of the castle､ charge over Jerusalem, for he was a truly faithful man, and revered God above many.

content: 3 And I said unto them､ Let not the gates of Jerusalem be opened until hot be the sun, and while they are standing by let them close the doors､ and make them fast,—setting watches､ of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, every one in his watch､ and every one over against his own house.
content_old: 3 And I said unto them､ Let not the gates of Jerusalem be opened until hot be the sun, and while they are standing by let them close the doors､ and make them fast,—setting watches､ of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, every one in his watch､ and every one over against his own house.

content: 4 Now the city was broad on both hands､ and large, but the people were few in the midst thereof,—and the houses had not been built.
content_old: 4 Now the city was broad on both hands､ and large, but the people were few in the midst thereof,—and the houses had not been built.

content: 5 So then my God put it into my heart, and I gathered together the nobles and the deputies and the people､ to register their genealogy,—then found I a register roll､ of them who came up at the first, and found written therein:—
content_old: 5 So then my God put it into my heart, and I gathered together the nobles and the deputies and the people､ to register their genealogy,—then found I a register roll､ of them who came up at the first, and found written therein:—

content: 6 These are the sons of the province､ who came up from among the Captives of the Exile, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon did exile,—but they came back to Jerusalem and to Judah､ every one to his own city;

content_old: 72 and that which the rest of the people gave was of gold twenty thousand darics, and of silver two thousand manehs,—and tunics for priests sixty-seven.

content: 1 Then all the people gathered themselves together､ as one man, into the broad way that was before the water-gate,—and they spake unto Ezra the scribe, to bring the book of the law of Moses, which Yahweh had commanded Israel.
content_old: 1 Then all the people gathered themselves together､ as one man, into the broad way that was before the water-gate,—and they spake unto Ezra the scribe, to bring the book of the law of Moses, which Yahweh had commanded Israel.

content: 2 So then Ezra the priest brought the law､ before the convocation of both men and women, and all that had understanding to hearken,—on the first day of the seventh month;
content_old: 2 So then Ezra the priest brought the law､ before the convocation of both men and women, and all that had understanding to hearken,—on the first day of the seventh month;

content: 3 and read therein､ before the broad place which was before the water-gate､ from the time it was light､ until the noon of the day, in presence of the men and the women､ and such as had understanding,—and the ears of all the people were unto the book of the law.
content_old: 3 and read therein､ before the broad place which was before the water-gate､ from the time it was light､ until the noon of the day, in presence of the men and the women､ and such as had understanding,—and the ears of all the people were unto the book of the law.

content: 4 And Ezra the scribe stood upon a lofty platform of wood､ which they had made for the purpose, and there stood､ beside him､ Mattithiah and Shema and Anaiah and Uriah and Hilkiah and Maaseiah､ on his right hand,—and on his left Pedaiah and Mishael and Malchijah and Hashum and Hashbaddanah､ Zechariah､ Meshullam.
content_old: 4 And Ezra the scribe stood upon a lofty platform of wood､ which they had made for the purpose, and there stood､ beside him､ Mattithiah and Shema and Anaiah and Uriah and Hilkiah and Maaseiah､ on his right hand,—and on his left Pedaiah and Mishael and Malchijah and Hashum and Hashbaddanah､ Zechariah､ Meshullam.

content: 5 And Ezra the scribe opened the book before the eyes of all the people, for above all the people was he,—and when he opened it all the people stood up.
content_old: 5 And Ezra the scribe opened the book before the eyes of all the people, for above all the people was he,—and when he opened it all the people stood up.

content: 6 And Ezra blessed Yahweh the great God,—and all the people responded Amen! Amen! with the lifting up of their hands,—and they bent their heads and bowed themselves down unto Yahweh､ with their faces to the ground.
content_old: 6 And Ezra blessed Yahweh the great God,—and all the people responded Amen! Amen! with the lifting up of their hands,—and they bent their heads and bowed themselves down unto Yahweh､ with their faces to the ground.

content: 7 And Jeshua and Bani and Sherebiah､ Jamin､ Akkub､ Shabbethai､ Hodiah､ Maaseiah､ Kelita､ Azariah､ Jozabad､ Hanan､ Pelaiah､ and the Levites did cause the people to understand the law, the people remaining in their places.
content_old: 7 And Jeshua and Bani and Sherebiah､ Jamin､ Akkub､ Shabbethai､ Hodiah､ Maaseiah､ Kelita､ Azariah､ Jozabad､ Hanan､ Pelaiah､ and the Levites did cause the people to understand the law, the people remaining in their places.

content: 8 So they read in the book of the law of God､ distinctly,—and､ giving the sense､ caused them to understand the reading.
content_old: 8 So they read in the book of the law of God､ distinctly,—and､ giving the sense､ caused them to understand the reading.

content: 9 Then Nehemiah—he was the governor—and Ezra the priest the scribe､ and the Levites who were causing the people to understand､ said unto all the people､ To-day is holy unto Yahweh your God, do not mourn､ nor weep,— for weeping were all the people､ when they heard the words of the law.
content_old: 9 Then Nehemiah—he was the governor—and Ezra the priest the scribe､ and the Levites who were causing the people to understand､ said unto all the people､ To-day is holy unto Yahweh your God, do not mourn､ nor weep,— for weeping were all the people､ when they heard the words of the law.

content: 10 So he said unto them— Go your way､ eat the fat and drink the sweet､ and send portions unto them for whom nothing is prepared, for holy is the day､ unto our Lord,—and be not grieved, for the joy of Yahweh is your strength.
content_old: 10 So he said unto them— Go your way､ eat the fat and drink the sweet､ and send portions unto them for whom nothing is prepared, for holy is the day､ unto our Lord,—and be not grieved, for the joy of Yahweh is your strength.

content: 11 And the Levites were quieting all the people､ saying— Hush! for the day is holy,—and be not grieved.
content_old: 11 And the Levites were quieting all the people､ saying— Hush! for the day is holy,—and be not grieved.

content: 12 And all the people went their way､ to eat and to drink､ and to send portions, and to make great rejoicing,—because they had understood the words which were made known unto them.
content_old: 12 And all the people went their way､ to eat and to drink､ and to send portions, and to make great rejoicing,—because they had understood the words which were made known unto them.

content: 13 And on the second day were gathered together—the ancestral heads of all the people､ the priests and the Levites, unto Ezra the scribe,—even to give attention unto the words of the law.
content_old: 13 And on the second day were gathered together—the ancestral heads of all the people､ the priests and the Levites, unto Ezra the scribe,—even to give attention unto the words of the law.

content: 14 And they found written in the law,—that Yahweh gave command through Moses, that the sons of Israel should dwell in booths､ during the festival of the seventh month;
content_old: 14 And they found written in the law,—that Yahweh gave command through Moses, that the sons of Israel should dwell in booths､ during the festival of the seventh month;

content: 15 and that they should publish and send along a proclamation throughout all their cities and throughout Jerusalem､ saying, Forth to the mountain､ and bring in branches of olive､ and branches of oleaster, and branches of myrtle､ and branches of palms, and branches of thick trees,—to make booths､ as it is written.
content_old: 15 and that they should publish and send along a proclamation throughout all their cities and throughout Jerusalem､ saying, Forth to the mountain､ and bring in branches of olive､ and branches of oleaster, and branches of myrtle､ and branches of palms, and branches of thick trees,—to make booths､ as it is written.

content: 16 So the people went forth､ and brought in, and made themselves booths､ every one upon his roof､ and in their courts, and in the courts of the house of God, and in the broad place of the water-gate, and in the broad place of the gate of Ephraim.
content_old: 16 So the people went forth､ and brought in, and made themselves booths､ every one upon his roof､ and in their courts, and in the courts of the house of God, and in the broad place of the water-gate, and in the broad place of the gate of Ephraim.

content: 17 And all the convocation of them who had returned out of the captivity made booths､ and dwelt in booths, for､ since the days of Jeshua son of Nun､ had not the sons of Israel done so, unto that day,—and there was very great rejoicing.
content_old: 17 And all the convocation of them who had returned out of the captivity made booths､ and dwelt in booths, for､ since the days of Jeshua son of Nun､ had not the sons of Israel done so, unto that day,—and there was very great rejoicing.

content: 1 Now on the twenty-fourth day of this month were the sons of Israel gathered together､ with fasting and with sackcloth, having earth upon them.
content_old: 1 Now on the twenty-fourth day of this month were the sons of Israel gathered together､ with fasting and with sackcloth, having earth upon them.

content: 2 And the seed of Israel separated themselves from all the sons of the foreigner,—and stood and made confession over their own sins, and the iniquities of their fathers.
content_old: 2 And the seed of Israel separated themselves from all the sons of the foreigner,—and stood and made confession over their own sins, and the iniquities of their fathers.

content: 3 So they stood up in their place, and read in the book of the law of Yahweh their God､ a fourth part of the day,—and a fourth part they were making confession and bowing themselves down, unto Yahweh their God.
content_old: 3 So they stood up in their place, and read in the book of the law of Yahweh their God､ a fourth part of the day,—and a fourth part they were making confession and bowing themselves down, unto Yahweh their God.

content: 4 Then stood up on the platform of the Levites､ Jeshua and Bani､ Kadmiel､ Shebaniah､ Bunni､ Sherebiah､ Bani､ Chenani,—and made outcry､ with a loud voice, unto Yahweh their God.
content_old: 4 Then stood up on the platform of the Levites､ Jeshua and Bani､ Kadmiel､ Shebaniah､ Bunni､ Sherebiah､ Bani､ Chenani,—and made outcry､ with a loud voice, unto Yahweh their God.

content: 5 Then said the Levites—Jeshua and Kadmiel､ Bani､ Hashabneiah､ Sherebiah､ Hodiah､ Shebaniah､ Pethahiah, Stand up､ bless Yahweh your God, from age to age,— Yea let them bless thy glorious Name, which is exalted above all blessing and praise.
content_old: 5 Then said the Levites—Jeshua and Kadmiel､ Bani､ Hashabneiah､ Sherebiah､ Hodiah､ Shebaniah､ Pethahiah, Stand up､ bless Yahweh your God, from age to age,— Yea let them bless thy glorious Name, which is exalted above all blessing and praise.

content: 6 Thou art Yahweh thou alone, Thou didst make the heavens､ the heavens of heavens､ and all their host､ the earth and all that is thereon､ the seas and all that is therein, and thou holdest them all in life,—and the host of the heavens unto thee are bowing down.
content_old: 6 Thou art Yahweh thou alone, Thou didst make the heavens､ the heavens of heavens､ and all their host､ the earth and all that is thereon､ the seas and all that is therein, and thou holdest them all in life,—and the host of the heavens unto thee are bowing down.

content: 7 Thou art Yahweh､ God, who didst choose Abram､ and broughtest him forth out of Ur of the Chaldees,—and madest his name Abraham;
content_old: 7 Thou art Yahweh､ God, who didst choose Abram､ and broughtest him forth out of Ur of the Chaldees,—and madest his name Abraham;

content: 8 and didst find his heart faithful before thee, and didst solemnise with him a covenant､ to give the land of the Canaanite､ the Hittite､ the Amorite､ and the Perizzite､ and the Jebusite､ and the Girgashite､—to give it unto his seed,—and didst confirm thy words, for righteous thou art.
content_old: 8 and didst find his heart faithful before thee, and didst solemnise with him a covenant､ to give the land of the Canaanite､ the Hittite､ the Amorite､ and the Perizzite､ and the Jebusite､ and the Girgashite､—to give it unto his seed,—and didst confirm thy words, for righteous thou art.

content: 9 Yea thou sawest the affliction of our fathers､ in Egypt, and their outcry thou heardest､ by the Red Sea;
content_old: 9 Yea thou sawest the affliction of our fathers､ in Egypt, and their outcry thou heardest､ by the Red Sea;

content: 10 and didst grant signs and wonders against Pharaoh､ and against all his servants､ and against all the people of his land, for thou hadst taken note､ that they ruled proudly over them,—and so thou didst make thee a name､ as at this day.
content_old: 10 and didst grant signs and wonders against Pharaoh､ and against all his servants､ and against all the people of his land, for thou hadst taken note､ that they ruled proudly over them,—and so thou didst make thee a name､ as at this day.

content: 11 And the sea didst thou cleave asunder before them, and they passed through the midst of the sea､ on dry ground,—whereas their pursuers thou didst cast into the depths like a stone､ into the mighty waters,
content_old: 11 And the sea didst thou cleave asunder before them, and they passed through the midst of the sea､ on dry ground,—whereas their pursuers thou didst cast into the depths like a stone､ into the mighty waters,

content: 12 And in a pillar of cloud didst thou lead them､ by day,—and in a pillar of fire､ by night, to light up for them the way wherein they should go.
content_old: 12 And in a pillar of cloud didst thou lead them､ by day,—and in a pillar of fire､ by night, to light up for them the way wherein they should go.

content: 13 And upon Mount Sinai camest thou down, and spakest with them out of the heavens,—and gavest them just regulations､ and faithful laws, good statutes and commandments.
content_old: 13 And upon Mount Sinai camest thou down, and spakest with them out of the heavens,—and gavest them just regulations､ and faithful laws, good statutes and commandments.

content: 14 And thy holy sabbath didst thou make known to them,—and commandments and statutes and a law didst thou command them, through Moses thy servant.
content_old: 14 And thy holy sabbath didst thou make known to them,—and commandments and statutes and a law didst thou command them, through Moses thy servant.

content: 15 And bread out of the heavens didst thou give them､ for their hunger, and waters out of the cliff didst thou bring them､ for their thirst,—and badest them go in to take possession of the land, which thou hadst lifted thy hand to give them.
content_old: 15 And bread out of the heavens didst thou give them､ for their hunger, and waters out of the cliff didst thou bring them､ for their thirst,—and badest them go in to take possession of the land, which thou hadst lifted thy hand to give them.

content: 16 But they and our fathers dealt proudly,—and hardened their neck, and hearkened not unto thy commandments;
content_old: 16 But they and our fathers dealt proudly,—and hardened their neck, and hearkened not unto thy commandments;

content: 17 but refused to hearken､ neither kept in mind thy wonders which thou hadst done with them, but they hardened their neck, and appointed a head that they might return to their servitude､ in their perverseness. But thou art a God of forgivenesses､ gracious and full of compassion､ slow to anger and abounding in lovingkindness､ and didst not forsake them.
content_old: 17 but refused to hearken､ neither kept in mind thy wonders which thou hadst done with them, but they hardened their neck, and appointed a head that they might return to their servitude､ in their perverseness. But thou art a God of forgivenesses､ gracious and full of compassion､ slow to anger and abounding in lovingkindness､ and didst not forsake them.

content: 18 Yea although they made them a molten calf, and said､ This is thy God､ that brought thee up out of Egypt,— and wrought great insults
content_old: 18 Yea although they made them a molten calf, and said､ This is thy God､ that brought thee up out of Egypt,— and wrought great insults

content: 19 yet thou in thine abounding compassions didst not forsake them in the desert,—the pillar of cloud departed not from over them by day､ to lead them in the way, nor the pillar of fire by night､ to light up for them the way wherein they should go.
content_old: 19 yet thou in thine abounding compassions didst not forsake them in the desert,—the pillar of cloud departed not from over them by day､ to lead them in the way, nor the pillar of fire by night､ to light up for them the way wherein they should go.

content: 20 And thy Good Spirit thou gavest､ to instruct them,—and thy manna thou withheldest not from their mouth, and water thou gavest them､ for their thirst.
content_old: 20 And thy Good Spirit thou gavest､ to instruct them,—and thy manna thou withheldest not from their mouth, and water thou gavest them､ for their thirst.

content: 21 Yea forty years didst thou sustain them in the desert､ they lacked nothing,—their mantles waxed not old and their feet swelled not.
content_old: 21 Yea forty years didst thou sustain them in the desert､ they lacked nothing,—their mantles waxed not old and their feet swelled not.

content: 22 And thou gavest them kingdoms､ and peoples, and allotted to each of them a corner,—and they took possession of the land of Sihon､ and the land of the king of Heshbon, and the land of Og king of Bashan.
content_old: 22 And thou gavest them kingdoms､ and peoples, and allotted to each of them a corner,—and they took possession of the land of Sihon､ and the land of the king of Heshbon, and the land of Og king of Bashan.

content: 23 Their children also didst thou multiply, like the stars of the heavens,—and didst bring them into the land which thou hadst promised their fathers they should enter to possess;
content_old: 23 Their children also didst thou multiply, like the stars of the heavens,—and didst bring them into the land which thou hadst promised their fathers they should enter to possess;

content: 24 so the children entered and possessed the land, and thou subduedst before them the inhabitants of the land､ the Canaanites, and deliveredst them into their hand,—with their kings､ and the peoples of the land, to do with them according to their pleasure;
content_old: 24 so the children entered and possessed the land, and thou subduedst before them the inhabitants of the land､ the Canaanites, and deliveredst them into their hand,—with their kings､ and the peoples of the land, to do with them according to their pleasure;

content: 25 and they captured fortified cities､ and a fat soil, and took possession of houses full of every good thing､ wells digged, vineyards and olive-yards and fruit-trees､ in abundance,—so they did eat and were filled and became fat, and luxuriated in thy great goodness.
content_old: 25 and they captured fortified cities､ and a fat soil, and took possession of houses full of every good thing､ wells digged, vineyards and olive-yards and fruit-trees､ in abundance,—so they did eat and were filled and became fat, and luxuriated in thy great goodness.

content: 26 But they murmured and rebelled against thee､ and cast thy law behind their back, and thy prophets they slew､ who testified against them that they might turn them back unto thee,—and they wrought great insults.
content_old: 26 But they murmured and rebelled against thee､ and cast thy law behind their back, and thy prophets they slew､ who testified against them that they might turn them back unto thee,—and they wrought great insults.

content: 27 Therefore didst thou deliver them into the hand of their adversaries, who distressed them,—and in the time of their distress they made outcry unto thee, and thou out of the heavens didst hear, and according to thine abounding compassions gavest them saviours, that they might save them out of the hand of their adversaries.
content_old: 27 Therefore didst thou deliver them into the hand of their adversaries, who distressed them,—and in the time of their distress they made outcry unto thee, and thou out of the heavens didst hear, and according to thine abounding compassions gavest them saviours, that they might save them out of the hand of their adversaries.

content: 28 But as soon as they had rest they again wrought wickedness before thee,—and thou didst leave them in the hand of their enemies､ who bare rule over them, yet when they again made outcry unto thee thou from the heavens didst hear and didst deliver them according to thy compassions､ many times;
content_old: 28 But as soon as they had rest they again wrought wickedness before thee,—and thou didst leave them in the hand of their enemies､ who bare rule over them, yet when they again made outcry unto thee thou from the heavens didst hear and didst deliver them according to thy compassions､ many times;

content: 29 and didst testify against them､ to bring them back unto thy law､ yet they dealt proudly､ and hearkened not unto thy commandments､ and against thy regulations they sinned, the which—if any son of earth shall do—then shall he live by them,—and yielded a rebellious shoulder, and their neck they stiffened､ and hearkened not.
content_old: 29 and didst testify against them､ to bring them back unto thy law､ yet they dealt proudly､ and hearkened not unto thy commandments､ and against thy regulations they sinned, the which—if any son of earth shall do—then shall he live by them,—and yielded a rebellious shoulder, and their neck they stiffened､ and hearkened not.

content: 30 And thou didst suffer many years to pass over them, and didst testify against them by thy Spirit through thy prophets､ yet did they not give ear,—therefore didst thou deliver them into the hand of the peoples of the lands.
content_old: 30 And thou didst suffer many years to pass over them, and didst testify against them by thy Spirit through thy prophets､ yet did they not give ear,—therefore didst thou deliver them into the hand of the peoples of the lands.

content: 31 Yet in thine abounding compassions thou didst not make of them an end､ neither didst thou forsake them,—for a GOD gracious and full of compassion thou art.
content_old: 31 Yet in thine abounding compassions thou didst not make of them an end､ neither didst thou forsake them,—for a GOD gracious and full of compassion thou art.

content: 32 Now therefore､ O our God—the GOD great､ mighty､ and fearful—keeping the covenant and the lovingkindness, let not all the trouble seem little before thee､ which hath come upon us—on our kings､ on our rulers､ and on our priests､ and on our prophets､ and on our fathers､ and on all thy people,—from the days of the kings of Assyria, until this day.
content_old: 32 Now therefore､ O our God—the GOD great､ mighty､ and fearful—keeping the covenant and the lovingkindness, let not all the trouble seem little before thee､ which hath come upon us—on our kings､ on our rulers､ and on our priests､ and on our prophets､ and on our fathers､ and on all thy people,—from the days of the kings of Assyria, until this day.

content: 33 But thou art righteous, as to all that hath fallen upon us,—for faithfulness hast thou wrought､ whereas we have been lawless;
content_old: 33 But thou art righteous, as to all that hath fallen upon us,—for faithfulness hast thou wrought､ whereas we have been lawless;

content: 34 and our kings､ our rulers､ our priests､ and our fathers have not kept thy law,—nor given heed unto thy commandments, or unto thy testimonies､ wherewith thou hast testified against them.
content_old: 34 and our kings､ our rulers､ our priests､ and our fathers have not kept thy law,—nor given heed unto thy commandments, or unto thy testimonies､ wherewith thou hast testified against them.

content: 35 But they in their kingdom､ and in thine abundant goodness which thou gavest them､ and in the broad and fat land which thou didst set before them did not serve thee, neither turned they from their wicked doings.
content_old: 35 But they in their kingdom､ and in thine abundant goodness which thou gavest them､ and in the broad and fat land which thou didst set before them did not serve thee, neither turned they from their wicked doings.

content: 36 Lo! we to-day are bondmen—even upon the land which thou gavest our fathers to eat the fruit thereof and the good thereof lo! we are bondmen;
content_old: 36 Lo! we to-day are bondmen—even upon the land which thou gavest our fathers to eat the fruit thereof and the good thereof lo! we are bondmen;

content: 37 and the increase thereof aboundeth unto the kings whom thou hast set over us､ for our sins,—and over our bodies are they bearing rule､ and over our cattle､ at their pleasure, and in great distress we are.
content_old: 37 and the increase thereof aboundeth unto the kings whom thou hast set over us､ for our sins,—and over our bodies are they bearing rule､ and over our cattle､ at their pleasure, and in great distress we are.

content: 28 And the rest of the people—the priests､ the Levites､ the doorkeepers､ the singers､ the Nethinim､ and all who had separated themselves from the peoples of the lands unto the law of God, their wives､ their sons and their daughters,—every one having knowledge and understanding

content: 29 were holding fast unto their distinguished brethren, and were entering into a curse and into an oath､ to walk in the law of God, which was given through Moses the servant of God,—and to observe and do､ all the commandments of Yahweh our Lord, and his regulations､ and his statutes;
content_old: 29 were holding fast unto their distinguished brethren, and were entering into a curse and into an oath､ to walk in the law of God, which was given through Moses the servant of God,—and to observe and do､ all the commandments of Yahweh our Lord, and his regulations､ and his statutes;

content: 30 and that we would not give our daughters unto the peoples of the land､—and their daughters would we not take for our sons;
content_old: 30 and that we would not give our daughters unto the peoples of the land､—and their daughters would we not take for our sons;

content: 31 and if the peoples of the land should be bringing in wares, or any corn on the sabbath day､ to sell we would not buy of them on the sabbath､ or on a holy day,—and that we would remit the seventh year､ and the loan of every hand.
content_old: 31 and if the peoples of the land should be bringing in wares, or any corn on the sabbath day､ to sell we would not buy of them on the sabbath､ or on a holy day,—and that we would remit the seventh year､ and the loan of every hand.

content: 32 And we laid on ourselves charges, appointing for ourselves the third of a shekel､ yearly,—for the service of the house of our God:
content_old: 32 And we laid on ourselves charges, appointing for ourselves the third of a shekel､ yearly,—for the service of the house of our God:

content: 33 for the bread to set in array､ and the continual meal-offering､ and for the continual ascending-sacrifice､ of the sabbaths､ of the new moons､ for the appointed feasts､ and for things hallowed､ and for victims bearing sin, to put a propitiatory—covering over Israel,—and for all the work of the house of our God.
content_old: 33 for the bread to set in array､ and the continual meal-offering､ and for the continual ascending-sacrifice､ of the sabbaths､ of the new moons､ for the appointed feasts､ and for things hallowed､ and for victims bearing sin, to put a propitiatory—covering over Israel,—and for all the work of the house of our God.

content: 34 Also lots did we cast､ concerning the offering of wood among the priests､ the Levites､ and the people, to bring it unto the house of our God､ by our ancestral houses､ at times arranged､ year by year,—to burn upon the altar of Yahweh our God, as it is written in the law.

content: 35 And that we would bring in the firstfruits of our ground､ and the first-fruit of all fruit of all trees､ year by year,—unto the house of Yahweh;
content_old: 35 And that we would bring in the firstfruits of our ground､ and the first-fruit of all fruit of all trees､ year by year,—unto the house of Yahweh;

content: 36 also that the firstborn of our sons､ and of our cattle, as it is written in the law,—and the firstlings of our herds and of our flocks we would bring in unto the house of our God, unto the priests who should be in attendance in the house of our God;

content: 37 and the first part of our meal and our heave-offerings and the fruit of all trees､ new wine and oil would we bring in unto the priests､ into the chambers of the house of our God, and the tithe of our ground unto the Levites,—the Levites themselves taking the tithes in all our cities of agriculture.

content: 38 And the priest the son of Aaron should be with the Levites､ when the Levites should take the tithes,—and the Levites should bring up the tithe of the tithe､ unto the house of our God, into the chambers pertaining unto the treasure-house.

content: 1 On that day a portion was read in the book of Moses､ in the ears of the people,—and it was found written therein, that the Ammonite and the Moabite should not enter into the convocation of God､ unto times age-abiding;

content: 2 because they met not the sons of Israel､ with bread and with water,—but hired against them Balaam､ to curse them, although our God turned the curse into a blessing.
content_old: 2 because they met not the sons of Israel､ with bread and with water,—but hired against them Balaam､ to curse them, although our God turned the curse into a blessing.

content: 3 So it came to pass､ when they had heard the law,—that they separated all the mixed multitude from Israel.

content: 4 Now before this EIiashib the priest, who was set over a chamber of the house of God was allied unto Tobiah;
